overview_of_class: Humans have been referred to as "the social animal," and for good reason: Our beliefs, our brains, and our physical environments are all profoundly shaped by our social context. This course will introduce you to the psychology of social behavior?how people think about, influence and relate to one another. Topics we will cover include aggression, altruism, conformity, prejudice, attraction, social perception, errors in social judgment and attitudes. Students will explore these topics by critically analyzing primary research within class discussions and activities. By analyzing empirical studies, students will learn how to evaluate scientific arguments, identify how different models and findings within social psychology relate to one another, and thoughtfully apply findings from social psychology to real-world situations.
name: Social Psychology
subject: PSYCH
